title: HW2
contents:
Read in a data set


library(tidyverse)
library(dplyr)
poultry <- read_csv("../Downloads/poultry_tidy.csv")



Explain the variables


cols(
  Product = col_character(), # string
  Month = col_character(), # string
  Year = col_double(), # numeric
  Price_Dollar = col_double() # numeric
)



Perform basic operations
Get highest price per product


poultry %>%
  arrange(desc(Price_Dollar)) %>%
  select(Product, Price_Dollar) %>%
  group_by(Product) %>%
  slice(1) %>%
  ungroup() %>%
  arrange(desc(Price_Dollar))


# A tibble: 5 x 2
  Product        Price_Dollar
  <chr>                 <dbl>
1 B/S Breast             7.04
2 Bone-in Breast         3.90
3 Whole                  2.48
4 Thighs                 2.22
5 Whole Legs             2.04

Get date of lowest price per product


poultry %>%
  arrange(Price_Dollar) %>%
  select(Product, Month, Year, Price_Dollar) %>%
  group_by(Product) %>%
  slice(1)


# A tibble: 5 x 4
# Groups:   Product [5]
  Product        Month    Year Price_Dollar
  <chr>          <chr>   <dbl>        <dbl>
1 B/S Breast     January  2012         6.38
2 Bone-in Breast January  2013         3.90
3 Thighs         July     2004         2.00
4 Whole          January  2004         1.98
5 Whole Legs     January  2004         1.94

title: Welcome to DACSS 601
description:
Welcome to DACSS 601: Foundations of Data Science. We hope you enjoy 
reading what we have to say!
